title: IDFC Bank to start operations from Oct 1
text: IDFC Bank to start operations from Oct 1 Gets final licence from RBI; Ex-CAG Vinod Rai to be the chairman of IDFC Infrastructure financier IDFC which received a universal banking licence from the Reserve Bank of India last year, will start banking operations from 1 October, 2015. IDFC which received in-principle operation from RBI in April last year, obtained the final approval from the banking regulator today. Infrastructure financier IDFC which received a universal banking licence from the Reserve Bank of India last year, will start banking operations from 1 October, 2015. IDFC which received in-principle operation from RBI in April last year, obtained the final approval from the banking regulator today. Bandhan, the micro lender which also received banking licence, will start operation from August 23. While Rajiv Lall will be the vice chairman and managing director of the bank, former home secretary Anil Baijal will be the chairman of the banking entity. Vinod Rai, the former Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) will be the non-executive chairman of IDFC. Lall who is now the chairman of IDFC, will step down as he will be the chief executive of the banking entity. Under Rai, CAG unearthed the 2G spectrum scam and Coal scam which rocked the previous UPA government and was eventually voted out of power in 2014. Rai will also be on the board of IDFC Bank. IDFC – the an infrastructure finance company which is a listed entity, has three finance subsidiaries — IDFC AMC, IDFC Alternatives, and IDFC Securities. In order to conform to RBI guidelines on the banking structure, it has to create a non-operative financial holding company (NOFHC) under IDFC and the three finance subsidiaries will have to be under the NOFHC, a 100% subsidiary of IDFC. Vikram Limaye, will continue to become the CEO & MD of IDFC. IDFC – the parent of the entire structure, will be the holding company, which will have two subsidiaries – the NOFHC and IDFC Foundation. While IDFC is already listed, IDFC Bank – where all the assets of IDFC will be transferred, will be listed from the day it starts operations. The loan book of IDFC was Rs 54,745 crore as on end March, 2015. An IDFC shareholder will get one share of IDFC Bank for every share of IDFC they hold. IDFC will have 51% stake in the bank and the rest will be held by existing shareholders. IDFC intend to start with 20 branches of which 15 branches will be in tier-IV centres (population of less than 10,000). All these 15 branches will be located in three districts of Madhya Pradesh – Khandwa, Harda and Hosangabad. The remaining 5 branches will be in metropolitan cities like Delhi and Mumbai
